claim: Suleiman the Magnificent oversaw the "Silver" age of the Ottoman Empire.
premise_source_doc_sentence: According to the Decline Thesis , following a golden age associated with the reign of Sultan Suleiman the Magnificent  (  r. 1520 -- 1566  )  , the empire gradually entered into a period of all-encompassing stagnation and decline from which it was never able to recover , lasting until the empire 's dissolution in 1923 .

claim: Suleiman the Magnificent oversaw the "Silver" age of the Ottoman Empire.
premise_source_doc_sentence: He was a distinguished poet and goldsmith ; he also became a great patron of culture , overseeing the `` Golden '' age of the Ottoman Empire in its artistic , literary and architectural development .

claim: Suleiman the Magnificent oversaw the "Silver" age of the Ottoman Empire.
premise_source_doc_sentence: After the publication of numerous new studies throughout the 1980s , 1990s , and 2000s , and the reexamination of Ottoman history through the use of previously untapped sources and methodologies , academic historians of the Ottoman Empire achieved a consensus that the entire notion of Ottoman decline was a myth -- that in fact , the Ottoman Empire did not stagnate or decline at all , but rather continued to be a vigorous and dynamic state long after the death of Suleiman the Magnificent .

claim: Suleiman the Magnificent oversaw the "Silver" age of the Ottoman Empire.
premise_source_doc_sentence: In 1520 , Suleiman became the Sultan at the age of 25 , succeeding his father Selim I  (  who had himself more than doubled the size of the Empire through his own campaigns  )  , and began a series of military conquests .

claim: Suleiman the Magnificent oversaw the "Silver" age of the Ottoman Empire.
premise_source_doc_sentence: The imperial campaigns  (  سفر همايون , sefer-i humāyūn  )  The Ottoman Turkish name for the imperial campaigns , according to Şemseddin Sâmî  (  Frashëri  )  in his book  (  Kamûs-ül Â ` lâm  )  of Suleiman the MagnificentSuleiman the Magnificent is also known as Suleiman I  (  سلطان سليمان اول , Sultān Suleimān-i evvel or , Kānūnī Sultān Suleimān , Modern Turkish : I. Süleyman or Kânûnî Sultân Süleymân ; 6 November 1494 -- 5/6/7 September 1566  )  were a series of campaigns led by Suleiman , who was the tenth and longest-reigning Sultan of the Ottoman Empire .
